betterquesting.name: Beginning Tinker's
betterquesting.desc:
Tinker's Construct is a mod that allows you to create custom tools and modify them to your liking. A lot of other mods have created combatability patches for Tinker's with additional Materials and effects.

There are Five Basic Benches you'll need to get started with Tinker's. Craft Them up and I'll give you some materials to make some basic tools.

The §3§1Crafting Table §0is similar to the Crafting Bench. You can use it exactly like the Bench with the added benefit of being able to keep items on it when not in use.

The §1Stencil Table §0allows the creation of § §c§c§4Patterns. §0There is a pattern for every part needed in Tinker's construct.

The §1Pattern Chest §0is used for holding §4Patterns §0and §4Casts. §0If you place the §1Pattern Chest §0inbetween the §1Stencil Table §0and §1Part Builder, §0you can insert or remove §4Patterns§0 while using another table.

The §1Part Builder§0 is used for creating Tinker's Parts, You can put the pattern you want in the Left Slot and whatever material you want in the right slots. Ignore the two slots and symbols. They both function the same. 

§lTIP: §0Sometimes when creating a Part, you'll receive a Shard. These shards are worthless. There is a config option to allows metal parts to be crafted in a part builder. I have turned this off. If I had enabled it, you'd be able to put Metal Shards into the Smeltery to conserve your alloys. 

The Final Table is a §1Tool Station. §0The Tool station allows you to assemble your parts into beautiful tools.

§lTIP: §0The §1Tool Station §0will only let you craft basic tools. In order to craft a Cleaver, Excavator, Hammer etc. you will need the §3Tool Forge. §0We'll go over that later.

betterquesting.name: Sharpening Kits
betterquesting.desc:
Craft a Sharpening Kit cast.

If a Sharpening Kit is made out of the same material as your tool's head, It will allow you to repair damage on the fly. No need for a Tool Bench. 

If a Sharpening Kit is made out of a superior material then your tool's head, you can upgrade the head to that mining level. Just add a piece of flint and the Kit to a Tool Bench. 

§9Example 1: §rIf you have a Pickaxe with an Iron Head, and a Sharpening Kit made out of Iron, you can repair damage to that pick.
§9Example 2: §rIf you have a pickaxe with an Iron Head, and a Sharpening Kit made out of Obsidian, you can upgrade your Pick's mining level to Obsidian.

betterquesting.name: Pickaxe Head
betterquesting.desc:
Craft a pickaxe head cast. 

§lTIP: §0the easiest first day Pickaxe head to craft is flint. The best first day Pickaxe head is Bone.

betterquesting.name: Axe Head Cast
betterquesting.desc:
Craft an axe head cast.

§lTIP §0If you use the cast to create a hatchet, you can clear leaves from trees without using the tool's durability.

betterquesting.name: Shovel Cast
betterquesting.desc:
Cast a shovel cast.

§lTIP: §0Don't add Lapis to your shovel. If you increase the Luck level, you'll find yourself getting much more flint than sand.

betterquesting.name: Tool Rod
betterquesting.desc:
The basic tool rod only only provides a durability increase and the ability of the Part's material.

§lTIP:§0 Don't EVER create your tool rod from Flint, Stone, Firewood or Ardite. This results in a negative durability modifier. Do it only if you have the resources to quickly make your tool unbreakable.

betterquesting.name: Binding Cast
betterquesting.desc: Craft a binding cast. There's not much to say about it. It only affects durability and the material's effect.

betterquesting.name: Hammer Head cast head
betterquesting.desc: The Hammer is an upgraded version of the Pickaxe. It allows you to mine a 3x3 area by default.

betterquesting.name: Broad Axe cast
betterquesting.desc:
Crafting the Lumberaxe allows you to chop down full trees in one swing. 

§lTIP: §0If you chop above the base of a tree, it will only clear that block and all blocks above it, leaving the base behind.

betterquesting.name: Excavator Head Cast
betterquesting.desc:
The excavator is the upgraded version of a shovel. It allows you to dig in a 3x3 area.

§lTIP: §C§0Creating an upgraded tool, does not mean you should get rid of your standard tools. There is no way to turn off the increased AOE that the upgraded tools provide.

betterquesting.name: Large Tool Rod cast
betterquesting.desc:
The large tool rod offers the same benefits of a Regular tool rod however, you can also use it in an "extra" slot.

§lTIP: §0The negative effects of using a Large Tool Rod as a handle may not apply to the "extra" slot. A large Obsidian Tool Rod provides -200 durability as a handle but provides +150 if used as an extra. Make sure you look carefully at how a material will affect your tool.

betterquesting.name: Tough Binding Cast
betterquesting.desc: The Tough Binding is exactly the same as the regular binding. The only difference is where it's used. Tough Bindings are used in the Tier 2 tools.

betterquesting.name: Ingot Cast
betterquesting.desc:
Sometimes, you may have put too much ore into your smeltery and cannot create anymore blocks in your §6§3§1§4Casting Basin. §rFor this, you have an §1Ingot cast. §r

The Ingot cast allows you to create one ingot from the ore in your smeltery. In order to create it, put any ingot in the §4Casting Table §rand pour some gold over it.

betterquesting.name: Nugget Cast
betterquesting.desc: The §1Nugget Cast §rfunctions the same as the §4Ingot Cast. §rThere may not be enough molten metal in your smeltery to create an ingot, so use the Nugget cast instead.

betterquesting.name: Gem Cast
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Wide Guard cast
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Hand Guard Cast
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Cross Guard Cast
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Sword Blade Cast
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Knife Blade Cast
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Large Sword Blade Cast
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: The Pattern Preparation
betterquesting.desc:
Craft up some §1Patterns. §0The recipe is simple. It's Sticks and Planks. 

§lTIP: §0Don't craft more than 32 Blank Patterns. There aren't that many stencils and they're reusable.

betterquesting.name: The Stencil Situation
betterquesting.desc:
Put those §4Blank Patterns §0to good use. Using your §1Stencil Table,§0 craft the following:

Pickaxe Head 
Axe Head
Shovel Head
Tool Rod
Binding

These Patterns will allow you to create your starter tools. 

Finish this and I'll give you some sword parts.

betterquesting.name: The Part Building Process
betterquesting.desc:
You've created the Stencils, Let's make the parts. I've given you enough materials to make a decent first Tool. Craft me up the following Parts.

1 x Pickaxe Head
1 x Shovel Head
1 x Axe Head
3 x Tool Rods
3 x Tool Binding

§c§lNOTE: I've set up the quests to allow you to submit any tool part. Ignore that the quest is expecting Stone.

betterquesting.name: The Part Building Process
betterquesting.desc:
Now that you've crafted your patterns, It's time to assemble your parts. I've given you more than enough resources to make decent parts.

Use the §1Part Builder §0to make me the following parts.§0§r§r §r§0§n§n§0§r§n§n§0§r§l§r§rMake them §nfrom stone§0 and you can choose the Part you want as a reward.


1 x Pickaxe Head
1 x Axe Head
1 x Shovel Head
3 x Tool Binding
3 x Tool Rod

§c

betterquesting.name: Tool Teratisms
betterquesting.desc:
Final Stretch for basic tools peeps. Go to your Tool Bench and select the tool you want. 

You can shift-click the parts into the Bench, They'll go into their proper areas, don't worry. 

Create a §6Pickaxe, §0A §8§9Shovel, §0and A §a§9§7§6§5Hatchet§r from your parts. I'll give you some extra modifiers for the next part.

§4§3§7§4§c§lNOTE: §b§cIgnore the icon on the Retrieval Task. You can craft whatever you want and it will count towards the quest.

betterquesting.name: The Smeltery Smorgasbord
betterquesting.desc:
Now that you have some basic tools, It's time to begin work on your Tinker's Smeltery. 

The Tinker's Smeltery allows you to Double your ore production during early game. For every one ore you put into the smeltery, two ingots can be produced. Additionally, the smeltery allows you to create metal parts for your tools and upgrade them to greater usefullness. 

To begin with, Grab some §8Gravel, §6Sand §rand §7Clay. §rA stack of each should do it to begin with. 

NOTE: For every quest you complete in this set, I'll give you a piece of the smeltery.

betterquesting.name: The Modifier Mechanic
betterquesting.desc:
Another thing that Tinker's offers is the ability to use Modifiers on your tools. I've changed the config files to allow 5 Modifiers on a new tool. Additionally, the Tinker's Leveling mod allows you to put more modifiers on your tools as you use them. This has been changed as well so that a couple of blocks mined and trees felled and you can have 10 modifiers for nothing. 

§cNOTE: Most modpacks will not allow the abuse of this mechanic. I've lowered the leveling threshold so you can have fun trying things out. This is a tutorial pack after all.

§rGo to your Tinker's Tool Bench and shift-click your tool. It will go into the Middle slot. Next shift-click the Silky Jewel received in the last quest. Take the tool from the rightmost slot and the modifier is now applied!

The Silky Jewel allows you to put Silktouch on your tool. It's crafted by surrouding an Emerald with 4 Silky Cloth in the Cardinal Directions.

§4WARNING: Applying Silktouch to your tool will remove the ability to add "Luck" to your tool later on.

betterquesting.name: The Grout Groundwork
betterquesting.desc:
Using your §8Gravel, §r§6Sand, §rand §7Clay, §rcraft up some Grout. 

NOTE: The grout recipe is part of something called "Shapeless crafting" This means that you can place the materials on a crafting bench in any order and it will make the item for you.

betterquesting.name: Segmented Seared Bricks
betterquesting.desc: Put the Grout into a furnace and it will become seared bricks.

betterquesting.name: Sempiternal Seared Bricks
betterquesting.desc:
Seared Bricks are made by placing Seared Brick in a 4x4 pattern on a crafting bench. I want you to craft 30 of them.

§cNOTE: You will have 8 seared brick left over from this task. Keep them. You'll be using them later.

betterquesting.name: Smectic Smeltery
betterquesting.desc:
Align your seared bricks in the following manner. Select the checkbox when complete. 

1. clear a 3x3 hole in the ground. Place 9 seared bricks in it's place.
2. Put your smeltery controller in the center just outside your 3x3 Plot
3. Put your Smeltery Drains to the left and right on the controllers
4. Click your faucets onto the Smeltery Drains
5. Dig a hole in front of your Smeltery Drains. Put the Casting Table and Casting Basin in the hole.
6. Surround the 3x3 Plot With Seared Bricks leaving one space open for your Smeltery Tank.
7. Stack one more set of Seared Bricks on top of your structure. 
8. If set up correctly, the smeltery controller will light up and begin to smoke.
9. Put your bucket of lava into the Smeltery Tank. The tank can hold 4 buckets of lava (4000 mb)

NOTE: There is a picture of the smeltery in your "Materials and You" book supplied when you enter the world. Use that to verify your setup. 

§cNOTE: I only had you craft enough bricks to make the basic smeltery. If you want corners on your smeltery, you'll need to gather more materials yourself.
§r
DISCLAIMER: To geologists: I am aware that Smectic applies to crystalline structures and does not make sense for this title. Alliteration is hard.

betterquesting.name: Quick as Redstone
betterquesting.desc:
Applying §4Redstone §r(Blocks or Dust) to your tool give it §4Haste. §rI have given you 15 redstone blocks and 45 redstone dust. This will allow you to apply the first level of haste to your tool. §1(5 blocks & 15 dust for each tool) §rIn the Tool bench, you can view how close you are to acheiving the next level. 

There are three levels of Haste for your tool. Haste, Hastester, and Hastestest. Each level takes one modifier.

§cTIP: You can apply as much redstone to your tool as you want. It will not consume a modifier until you reach the level itself.

betterquesting.name: Lucky as Lapis
betterquesting.desc:
Once again I've given you all the materials you need to apply the first level of luck to each of your tools. 

You can have up to "Luck III" on your tools. 

As always, so long as you have not finished your current tier of Luck, a modifier will not be consumed.

§4WARNING: If Silktouch is on your tool, Luck cannot be applied to it.

betterquesting.name: Sharp as Quartz
betterquesting.desc:
Applying Quartz to your tools makes them Sharper. Apply the first level of Sharpness to your tools. It takes 18 Quartz Blocks for the First level.

There are three levels of Sharp: Sharp, Sharpest, and Sharpestest. 

Note: Standard Nether quartz can also be applied for get the modifier.

betterquesting.name: Calling for Reinforcements.
betterquesting.desc:
Take the Reward you received for the last task and Craft up 3 Reinforcements. 

Reinforcements stack up to five times on your tools. Each Reinforced level will consume one modifier.

TIP: Applying 5 Reinforcements to your tool will make it Unbreakable.

betterquesting.name: Mending from Moss.
betterquesting.desc:
If you have the levels, you can right click a bookshelf with a ball of Moss to turn it into §a§2Mending Moss. §rI've given you the levels, so try it out now.
§r
§rIf Mending Moss is applied to a tool, it will gain Mending. With mending, any XP you pick up will be used to repair your tool instead. In standard mod packs, It may take awhile to put Unbreakable on your tools. §2Mending Moss §rcan help you repair your tools in the meantime.

betterquesting.name: Lifestealing Bones
betterquesting.desc:
Applying §4Necrotic Bones §rto your tools gives them lifesteal. If you want to get more necrotic bones, You'll have to venture into the Nether. The bones drop from Wither Skeletons.

You can apply up to 10 levels of Necrotic to your tool. I highly recommend you apply it to your weapons though.

betterquesting.name: Empowering with Embossing
betterquesting.desc:
This is a fun modifier. §1Embossing§r allows you to transfer the §c§4ability §rof a tool part onto your current tool without using a modifier. This can only be done once per tool so make sure the Tool Part has a trait you want before doing it.

I've given you all you need to emboss your current tools. The cobalt tool parts give an ability called §3Lightweight. §rThis makes your tools faster and stacks with your tool's current Haste level. 

Applying an embossment is Shapeless Crafting. Put the Tool in the center of your Tool Forge and the pieces anywhere around it.

§cNOTE:  Upgrading a tool part will keep the embossment.

betterquesting.name: Reaching New Heights
betterquesting.desc:
Next we'll work on the §1Height Expander. §rWhen applied to your tool, you can mine in a 1x3 area. The expander is a cheap way to give your boring basic tools some abilites to mimic the Upgraded ones. Up to three Height Expanders can be applied to your tool at once. this allows for a 1x6 area when fully upgraded. 

Craft up a Height Expander. Apply it to your tool. We'll be going over the Width Expander next.

betterquesting.name: Reaching New Sides?
betterquesting.desc:
The §1Width Expander §ris similar to the §c§4Height Expander §rbut for the Horizontal axis. Applying one to your tool will allow you to mine in a 3x1 area.

If the Width Expander is on the same tool as a Height Expander, you can mine in a 3x3 area. When fully upgraded, you can mine in a 6x6 area.

Craft up some Width Expanders, apply them to your tools and watch yourself chew through the landscape.

§cNOTE: If you're going to apply Width and Height Modifiers to your tools in a normal modpack, don't do it to your primary tools. You cannot turn these abilities off and you may want to mine in a small area.

betterquesting.name: Something Fishy
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Webbed for your Pleasure
betterquesting.desc:
Modded allows you to craft up cobwebs. Unfortunaely you're a long ways from Mana Infused String so I have given you some. 

If you have a cobweb, you can apply §1Webbed§r to a weapon or tool. This modifier can only be applied once.

Webbed will slow your enemies for 2 seconds. Handy for quick escape.

betterquesting.name: Shulking Away
betterquesting.desc:
Put that Chorus Fruit into a furnace to turn it into §1Popped Chorus Fruit. §rThis will allow you to apply the Shulking Modifier.

If you hit a player or mob with a Shulking tool, you can make them levitate for a bit.

The more §1Popped Chorus Fruit §ryou apply to a tool, the longer the levitation will last. I've given you enough to apply the first level of Shulking to one tool.

NOTE: You can apply as much Popped Chorus Fruit as you want to a tool without using a Modifier. As soon as you reach the next level, a modifier will be taken instead.

betterquesting.name: Glowing Away
betterquesting.desc:
Craft up 3 eyes of ender and Break that glowstone until you have 6 dust. These Items will allow you to get the §1Glowing Modifier

§rThe Glowing Modifier is awesome. Whenever you enter an area that is too dark, It will automatically place a light in your area in exchange for tool Durability. The light will be placed when the game senses you are light level 7 or below. Combine this modifier with Unbreakable and you won't need to bring torches on your mining trips.

§cNOTE: The light that gets placed is a small glob on the ground. It's kind of difficult to see. If you want to place a block where the glob is, you will not be able to since the glob is taking up that block space.

betterquesting.name: Blasting Off Again
betterquesting.desc:
Craft up some TNT. I've given you enough for 9. 

Putting 3 TNT on your tool in a Tool Bench will make it Explosive. Whenever you mine, you will instead blow up the area in front of you. You can apply up to three levels onto one tool. You can apply all three levels onto the tool for the cost of one Modifier.

§cWARNING: The explosion of this modifier works just like Vanilla TNT. Using it means theres a risk of blowing up something Valuable. Apply it only to a tool that you would use for generic mining. 

NOTE: You cannot Apply TNT to weapons. It would be absolutley hilarious if you could though.

betterquesting.name: Spider-Slayer
betterquesting.desc:
Craft up some §4Fermented Spider Eyes. 

§rApplying Fermented Spider Eyes to your tools or weapons allows you to do more damage to Spiders. This ability can stack up to 10 times.

betterquesting.name: Off with their Heads!
betterquesting.desc:
Putting a piece of Obsidian and an Enderpearl into the Tool Bench will apply Beheading to your tools. This modifier stacks up to 10 times. 

For each level of Beheading on your tool, the odds of Getting a mob head are increased. This is particularly handy for Wither Skeletons but applies to Enderman, Skeletons, and Zombies too.

I've given you 32 zombie eggs. Get me 2 heads and we'll move on.

§cNOTE: Altough you can apply Beheading to your tools, you're better off applying it to a weapon instead. Why waste a perfectly good modifer on a Pickaxe when you'll rarely be fighting with it?

ANOTHER NOTE: The Cleaver Weapon has Beheading on it by default. It stacks with this modifier so go nuts!

betterquesting.name: Oh Mighty Smiter!
betterquesting.desc:
Craft up some Graveyard Soil. It's Shapeless Crafting so don't worry about the order. 

This Graveyard Soil buffs mobs that walk over it. However, if it's put through a smelter, It becomes Consecrated Soil.

Consecrated Soil harms mobs that walk over it. If you apply it to your tools, it adds Smite. Smite stacks up to 10 times and allows you to increase your damage on Undead Mobs.

§cNOTE: Undead Mobs include Zombies, Skeletons, Zombie Pigman, Wither Skeletons and the Wither.

betterquesting.name: Fire and the Flames
betterquesting.desc:
Adding Blaze Powder to your tools puts the Fiery Buff on it. This modifier can stack.

Fire Damage is a double-edged buff. If you ignite a mob, it has the chance to ignite you if it strikes you. Be careful or apply Kockback to your tools to push them away.

betterquesting.name: Piston Pushers
betterquesting.desc:
Applying a Piston (or sticky Piston) to a tool applies Knockback to your tools. Not much else to say. 

The knockback modifier does stack though. At maximum strength, You can knock a mob more than a chunk away. It's pretty funny.

§cNOTE: Be careful when using Knockback, if it's too weak when hitting a Skeleton, you'll be giving it the advantage.

betterquesting.name: Forging Ahead
betterquesting.desc:
Now that you have your smeltery up and running, it's time to replace your Tool Bench with a §1Tool Forge.

§rThe §1Tool Forge §rdoes everything the Tool Bench can and also allows you to craft up Upgraded versions of the tools offered by the Tool Bench. This includes the Hammer, The Excavator, The Lumberaxe and Crossbow. 

The next part of this tutorial is Modifiers. The reward for this task is §5Creative Modifiers. §rWhen you place your Tool into the Tool Forge, just shift-click the modifiers onto the bench and add extras onto the tool. You're going to need them.

betterquesting.name: Arrow Shaft
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Fletching
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Arrowhead Cast
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Bowstring
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Large Plate Cast
betterquesting.desc:
Large Plates are needed for for Tier 2 Tools.  Create the cast and continue.

TIP: A Large Plate provides the Attack and Durability of your tool. When used in a Crossbow, It affects Melee damage, not Arrow Damage.

betterquesting.name: Scythe Cast
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Sign Plate Cast
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Soulbinding
betterquesting.desc:
I have given you something powerful. A §c§e§dNetherStar. §rResist the urge to use it on something else and instead apply it to your tool. This will give you §1Soulbound.

§rSoulbinding a tool allows you to keep your Tools after death. If you've put a lot of time into your tools and die thousands of blocks away from spawn, you'll be able to retain your work. Soulbinding persists even after death, you will not need to reapply it to your tool.

§cNOTE: Persistant Soulbinding is a changable setting in the configs. Make sure you know what your modpack has set it to. Nothing's worse than thinking you're good after death only to discover that Soulbinding needs to be reapplied.

§rWith this, you've finished the Modifier Portion of this tutorial. I'm gonna give you a lot of Gold for making Casts.

betterquesting.name: Bowlimb Cast
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Pan Cast
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Efficient Emeralds
betterquesting.desc:
§rAdding an emerald to your tool increases the durability by 50% of it's current maximum, essentially the equivalent of the Effieciency Enchant in vanilla. If you don't already have a Diamond on it, it will also increase the mining level to IRON. Only one Emerald can be applied to your tool at once. It's wise to wait until you have a considerable ammount of durability before adding the Emerald.

§cNOTE: If your tool has an Emerald on it, you may notice that villagers will follow you around. They are attracted to the Emerald on your tool. This happens rarely but don't be surprised if it happens.

betterquesting.name: Durable Diamonds
betterquesting.desc:
Affixing a Diamond to your tool will increase it's durability by 500 points. It will also automatically upgrade the tool's mining level to Obsidian and provides minor stat increases for your weapons.

§cTIP: Only one Diamond can be applied to a tool. It §owill §ctake a modifier from your tool.

betterquesting.name: Mystic Terrarium
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Glowshroom Terrarium
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Koru Terrarium
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Flax Terrarium
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Wasteland Terrarium
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Sapling Terrarium
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Cactus Terrarium
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Mushroom Terrarium
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Flower Terrarium
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Ominous Terrarium
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Fern Terrarium
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Bamboo Terrarium
betterquesting.desc: No Description

betterquesting.name: Let's Get Started
betterquesting.desc:
Check the box and the world will be forced into peaceful. No mobs will spawn, and you won't lose hunger or saturation.

Save for a few simple things, Most of this chapter will be reading. By the time you're done with this section, You should be kitted out and ready for what we throw at you.

betterquesting.name: Punch those Trees!
betterquesting.desc:
This modpack is made for people who want to learn how to use mods in their base form. There will be very little changes to the §3Configuration Files, §rand I'll be sure to warn you if a change was made.

Lets begin how all games begin. Bring me some wood, I'll give you some tools.

§cNOTE: You can turn in any wood you want. Wood is part of the OreDictionary which is explained in another task.

betterquesting.name: Orating on the OreDictionary
betterquesting.desc:
There are hundreds of Mods available in this community. Many of them offer items that already exist. It's impossible to know what Mods a developer wants to put in a Modpack and so the §1OreDictionary §rwas born.

The OreDictionary makes it so that items introduced in one mod can be used in another. For example: Nine Mods in this pack add an Item called §3Copper Ingot. §rNormally if you needed a Copper Ingot for a Minefactory Reloaded recipe, you couldn't use a Copper Ingot from AbyssalCraft. Thanks to the OreDictionary, all Copper ingots have the same tag and are available to use in all recipes that require that Ingot. 

You may have noticed that this task has a cycling icon for what wood you need. This is the Oredictionary at work. Mousing over it will show you the Tag §3logWood.§r 

Press the Checkbox and we'll give you some food.

betterquesting.name: Looking at Light Levels
betterquesting.desc:
if you press §1F7, §ryou can view the light levels around you. They'll be shown with an §lX.

§rYou'll notice that some of the X's are §6yellow §rand some are §4red. §rThis is indicative of the area being Light Level 7 or below.

The §6Yellow X's §rmean that mobs will be able to Spawn in this area after the Sun goes down.

The §4Red X's §rmean that Mobs will be able to spawn regardless of the time of day.

§cNOTE: So long as you are within 25 Blocks of an area, Mobs will not be able to spawn regardless of the light level.

betterquesting.name: Checking your Chunks
betterquesting.desc:
Pressing §1F9 §rwill show you chunk borders. Alternatively Vanilla Minecraft offers this by hitting §1F3+G.

§rWhen using the §1F9 Method, §ryou can press it once to view the Full Chunk with nothing extra, represented by §cRed Lines. §rPressing it a second time will split it up by standard blocks, shown in §2Green. §rRegardless, you'll see a §6Yellow Line §rinside the chunk. This is the center of that chunk.

Using the §1F3+G Method §rshows a little differently. There is only one option, The borders are shown by §9Blue Lines §rand the Walls are shown by §6Yellow §r2x2 squares. There is nothing indicating the center of the chunk.

betterquesting.name: Finished Reading? Good.
betterquesting.desc:
Check this box and the world will be set to Normal Difficulty. You'll lose saturation and hunger and mobs will begin to spawn.

Also, the Tinker's Construct, MineColonies and Pam's HarvestCraft will unlock. This will let you set up your own base and get some better tools for later on down the road. Enjoy!

betterquesting.name: Foraging For Food
betterquesting.desc:
ATM contains a Mod called §3Spice of Life. §rThis mod forces you to maintain a diet by eating as many different foods as possible. Every sixth food needs to be something different or you'll see diminishing returns on how many hunger bars you regain from eating.

Luckily we also have Pam's HarvestCraft which allows you to craft more food than you know what to do with.

Most of this section will provide you with various sandwiches to help you maintain your diet. You don't have to eat them yet since we're in peaceful but You're going to be happy you have them later on.

§cNOTE: One of the books you just got was called a Food Journal. This book keeps track of all food you've eaten to help you maintain your diet.

betterquesting.name: Ore Excavation
betterquesting.desc:
No it's not Veinminer.

OreExcavation allows you to mine out large portions of your world in one fell-swoop. It is by default bound to the GRAVE Key. The grave key is right above your TAB button on your keyboard and usually has the Tilde on it as well. 

OreExcavation makes it hard to maintain the Diet that the Spice of Life mod requires. OreExcavation takes a lot of Saturation and Hunger away per use. So be careful. Now do you see why I'm so keen to give you lots of food?

betterquesting.name: Bountiful Books
betterquesting.desc:
This isn't called All the Mods without good reason. There are over 200 Mods in this pack alone and there are always more being added. 

Some of these mods are massive on their own. Twilight Forest alone could take you days to obtain everything. Luckily, some mod developers saw fit to add books covering the essentials of their mods. We're going to give you§o§r§r§r §o§4§o§o§o§o§o§o§o§o§o§o§o§oAll of them. Right now. §r

We'll also throw in a Bibliocraft Bookcase. This handy tool will allow you to store 16 Books in one handy location.

§4§cWARNING: Make sure you have room for 17 items in your inventory or else Books will go flying everywhere. Who wants that?
